intro: Anneslia centralis, commonly known as the central starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Loasaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Anneslia centralis is a perennial herb that is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
